{"blocks":[{"key":"a4lu2","text":"Calculation of Tris or EDTA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blr7v","text":"Use the equation C1V1 = C2V2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b68if","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nul2","text":"Eg for EDTA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b74qa","text":"(0.5M)(X mL) = (0.04M)(500 mL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56dqt","text":"Solve for X","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a09tr","text":"((0.04M)(500 mL)/(0.5M)) = 40 mL of 0.5M EDTA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

100675.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"l6fg","text":"Add 100 µL lysozyme (125 mg fully dissolved in 1000 μl 1 x TE) and 20µL RNase A (10 µg/ml: 1µL in 999µL 1 x TE) to each filter.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"351c0","text":"Reseal the top with Parafilm or a luer cap.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ujtm","text":"Incubate Sterivex in a rotating incubator at 37°C for 1h (in labeled 50 ml falcon tubes).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jkb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf2qk","text":"Add 100 µL Proteinase K and 100 µL (20%) SDS to each filter. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp5fp","text":"Reseal using Parafilm or a luer cap.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mujo","text":"Incubate at 55°C for 1-2 hours in a rotating incubator (in 50ml falcon tubes; be sure to keep the same falcon tube for the same sterivex throughout these incubation steps).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8khc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63sqo","text":"Remove lysate from sterivex filter using a 10cc syringe into a labeled 15 ml falcon tube, use a new syringe for each sample. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99q0d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"auosk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgbud","text":"Repeat as needed until (nearly) all liquid and foam are out of Sterivex. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kb0q","text":"Add 1mL sucrose lysis buffer (SLB), rotate Sterivex with your hands several times to rinse the filter out, and then plunge out the liquid as described above. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"123bb","text":"Pool this with the lysate in the 15 ml tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":18,"offset":0,"style":"italic"},{"length":232,"offset":29,"style":"italic"}],"key":"fsb7f","text":"Do not pull up on the plunger while sterivex is attached. You will likely need to do multiple plunges to empty the Sterivex, so unscrew the syringe from the filter, pull back the plunger, reattach to Sterivex, and push and hold to plunge liquid out of Sterivex. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"640A79ABE91948C99E19A9932102DB5E"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2ajk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5u2e","text":"In the fume hood, add an equal volume (about 3mL) of Phenol:Chloroform:IAA (25:24:1), pH 8.0 to the lysate tube. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdmkr","text":"Invert for 10 secondsby hand to mix.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ejq","text":"Spin at 2500 g for 6 min or until the aqueous layer is clear. Wait at least 10 minutes before opening the centrifuge. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32rv4","text":"Transfer the aqueous (top) layer into a new 15 ml falcon tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djne8","text":"Add an equal volume (approx 3mL) of Chloroform:IAA (24:1) to the tube containing the aqueous layer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lgdp","text":"Invert for 10 seconds by hand. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"so5","text":"Spin at 2500 g for 6 min or until the aqueous layer is clear with no debris. Wait at least 10 minutes before opening the centrifuge. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b0m9","text":"Transfer the aqueous layer into a labeled Amicon Ultra centrifuge tube (UFC801096, EMD Millipore).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9edbf","text":"Top up Amicon with 1-2mL of 1 x TE buffer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m5sl","text":"Spin at 3500 g for 10-15 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c8ju","text":"Check to make sure there is less than 1ml liquid left in Amicon at the end of this (if not, fill up with 2mL 1 x TE and spin again).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e27lq","text":"Add 2 mL TE buffer to Amicon and spin at 3500 g for 6 min. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bqgm","text":"Remove filtrate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7d3pf","text":"Repeat Step 8 twice more (total of 3 washes with 2mL TE). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9jhv","text":"For the last wash, spin until 200 – 500 μl remain in Amicon (typically 8-10 minutes). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36c88","text":"Note the final volume and transfer to a labeled 1.5 μl Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfmdc","text":"Rinse Amicon sides with 50 µL of 1xTE and pool with the rest of the sample in a labeled 1.5mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dd9do","text":"If desired, aliquot 50 µL from the final sample volume into a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube to use as working stock and place in a -20°C freezer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50m2o","text":"Place the remaining DNA stock in the -80°C freezer for long-term storage.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5891m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ubvn","text":"Thaw filters on ice, if applicable. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sdt3","text":"Replace Parafilm on each sample if needed. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nqmc","text":"Prepare extraction negative - add 1800 µL of SLB (filter-sterilized and UVed) into a new Sterivex. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8htf4","text":"Seal the bottom with parafilm and the top with cap or parafilm, treat the same as the rest of the samples.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"baoc0","text":"The protocol assumes that water has been collected on a sterivex filter and preserved with Sucrose lysis buffer. See the following protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fab47","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a2kj3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":[{"affiliation":"Hakai Institute","affiliation_url":null,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/avatars/016.png","source":"/img/avatars/016.png","webp_source":""},"is_verified_user":null,"link":null,"name":"Colleen Kellogg","note":"","username":"colleen-kellogg"}],"created_at":1716825688,"creator":{"name":"Andreas Novotny","username":"andreas-novotny1"},"doi":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.rm7vzjxrrlx1/v1","doi_status":1,"fork_id":0,"guid":"609A364F1C4211EFA15F0A58A9FEAC02","has_subprotocols":1,"id":100674,"image":{"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qm8hcbk77.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qm8hcbk77.png","webp_placeholder":"","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnftcbk77.webp"},"is_unlisted":false,"load_collapsed":true,"public":true,"stats":null,"title":"Seawater Filtration for Microbial or Environmental DNA","title_html":"Seawater Filtration for Microbial or Environmental DNA","type_id":1,"uri":"seawater-filtration-for-microbial-or-environmental-deja3cie","version_data":{"code":"deja3cie","has_approved_merge_request":false,"has_pending_merge_request":false,"id":0,"is_parent_public":false,"is_same_owner":false,"merge_request":null,"parent_id":null,"parent_uri":null,"version_class":100674}}}}}

100896.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
100896.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2sesr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn88u","text":"This protocol assumes that samples have been collected and preserved according to this procedure:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":97},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":97}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ta75","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ct8ga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":[{"affiliation":"Hakai Institute","affiliation_url":null,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/avatars/016.png","source":"/img/avatars/016.png","webp_source":""},"is_verified_user":null,"link":null,"name":"Colleen Kellogg","note":"","username":"colleen-kellogg"}],"created_at":1716825688,"creator":{"name":"Andreas Novotny","username":"andreas-novotny1"},"doi":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.rm7vzjxrrlx1/v1","doi_status":1,"fork_id":0,"guid":"609A364F1C4211EFA15F0A58A9FEAC02","has_subprotocols":1,"id":100674,"image":{"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qm8hcbk77.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qm8hcbk77.png","webp_placeholder":"","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnftcbk77.webp"},"is_unlisted":false,"load_collapsed":true,"public":true,"stats":null,"title":"Seawater Filtration for Microbial or Environmental DNA","title_html":"Seawater Filtration for Microbial or Environmental DNA","type_id":1,"uri":"seawater-filtration-for-microbial-or-environmental-deja3cie","version_data":{"code":"deja3cie","has_approved_merge_request":false,"has_pending_merge_request":false,"id":0,"is_parent_public":false,"is_same_owner":false,"merge_request":null,"parent_id":null,"parent_uri":null,"version_class":100674}}}}}

100896.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
100896.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"apdju","text":"Set aside ATL buffer, AL buffer, proteinase K, RNase A and anhydrous ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahilb","text":"Put the ATL and AL buffers in the incubator to eliminate any precipitate that may be in the solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":101}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpnu6","text":"There is a cardboard box in the mini freezer with pro K aliquots. Each aliquot has enough volume for 12 samples. The anhydrous ethanol is stored in the CR1 mini fridge, and in the CR2 in the mini freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

100896.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
100896.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"42g7t","text":"Calculate the volume of each reagent you will need for each step and have a one-time-use tube to make an aliquot for that specific reagent. Try to add a little bit more than you need and dispose of the leftover. Prepare the aliquots inside the workstation (with HEPA filter).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":212,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

100896.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
100896.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bula0","text":"Cut the parafilm to a size of 1 cm x 5 cm, two or three per Sterivex – sometimes you will need to replace the parafilm in the Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

100896.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
100896.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bduih","text":"Wipe down the benches, centrifuge, and working areas using the PREempt solution/wipes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2er58","text":"Turn on the incubator and set the temperature to 56°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8he2u","text":"Thaw the Sterivex filters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iv8","text":"Remove the parafilm and remove Longmire’s buffer/SLB using a syringe. You can use a plastic “tripour” to dispose the buffer and then pour all of the volume in the sink. Rinse the tripour with water after use, dry and wipe it down using a paper towel and PREempt solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":169,"length":102}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39h2t","text":"If needed, dry the Sterivex inlet using a Kimwipes (one wipe per Sterivex). Place the Sterivex on a clean Kimwipe while preparing the other one Sterivexes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nt3i","text":"Add 0.1 mm silica beads (about 0.3 g or three spoons*) into the Sterivex using a weighting paper (make a funnel with the paper to slide in the beads, use one per Sterivex). *It is a white spoon that is stored in the drawer with the silica beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":28},{"style":"italic","offset":174,"length":71}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bdl24","text":"Seal the outlet port of the Sterivex filter unit with the parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kkop","text":"Inject 720 μL ATL buffer into the Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ab7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63fue","text":"One more Sterivex +ATL buffer should be prepared for the extraction blank for detecting contamination during DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f76t9","text":"Place the Sterivex in the vortex adapter and do the “bead-beating” for 10 min to promote cell lysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ufap","text":"Get one 50mL tube per sample, and put the Sterivexes inside the 50mL tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pba9","text":"Incubate the Sterivex at 56°C for 30 min while tilting or rotating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b37mj","text":"Repeat steps 15 and 16 one more time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bop18","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"sqv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"560FDF49BA7147EFAB17FA4FFDC6B4C1","id":0,"step_guid":"F0F05D461E1E11EF84A90A58A9FEAC02","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"261c3","text":"Add  80 μL proteinase-K to each Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"699jh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ap7ko","text":"Seal the outlet port of the Sterivex filter unit with a parafilm if you notice that some lysate is leaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92oj9","text":"Vortex tubes for ~10 s (or simply move it to mix the solution). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do8sh","text":"Place the Sterivexes back to the 50mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp22m","text":"Incubate tubes at 56°C for 2h while rotating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds1h6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21pct","text":"While warming the Sterivex filter unit to 56°C, prepare a 2.0 mL tube for DNA recovery (loBind DNA tubes). Note: write the necessary information on the cap of the 2.0 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d24b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6o274","text":"After completion of warming, carefully remove the parafilm and the luer fitting on the inlet port of the Sterivex filter unit, while preventing liquid inside from leaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23bfm","text":"Insert the inlet port of the Sterivex filter unit into the 2.0 mL tube and lightly push it down to the bottom of the 50mL conical tube. Then, close the cap of the conical tube firmly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15c7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7indg","text":"Put the conical tubes in the Megafuge adapters. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dga1r","text":"Centrifuge the conical tube containing the Sterivex filter unit at 6,000 x g for 1min and collect the extracted DNA in a 2 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aj0sc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h0im","text":"Remove the 50 mL conical tube from the centrifuge and remove the Sterivex filter unit and 2.0 mL tube using tweezers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apk5k","text":"Note: The 2.0 mL tube is uncapped; handle it carefully. Wipe down the tweezers with PREempt wipes between samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bebn","text":"Discard the used conical tubes (keep one conical tube and use it as a provisory waste container) and Sterivex filter unit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":32,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah5dv","text":"Firmly cap the 2.0 mL tube and proceed with these vials and lysate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqerj","text":"Add 4 μL of RNAseA (100 mg/mL). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9v9d2","text":"Mix pipetting up and down (or vortexing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsbsj","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvn3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auouk","text":"Add 200 μL buffer AL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"224j8","text":"Mix thoroughly pipetting up and down (or by vortexing). It may form some precipitate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55ndo","text":"Incubate at 56°C for 10 min (it doesn’t need to be in the rotisserie).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbi8q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ok1e","text":"Add 200  μL ethanol (96-100%). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"921t0","text":"Mix thoroughly pipetting up and down (or by vortexing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14i47","text":"Total volume now is ~1.2 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tiga","text":"Pipette 600 μL the mixture into a DNeasy mini spin column placed in a 2 mL collection tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cseat","text":"Place the tubes in the centrifuge and spin the tubes at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g) for 1 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn98f","text":"Discard the flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4p2g","text":"Repeat the previous step once more,  using the remaining volume of the lysate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amija","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2v9ss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"39C369B8FB3B48D09731D4C521361FB5","id":0,"step_guid":"F0F404FA1E1E11EF84A90A58A9FEAC02","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6oopj","text":"Place the spin column in a new 2 mL collection tube. If after spinning down you still can see some buffer in the spin column, centrifuge the tube again with a higher speed (about 10,000 x g). If this still not work, spin down with a higher speed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":53,"length":193}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5a6k","text":"Add 500 μL buffer AW1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7877m","text":"Centrifuge for 1 min at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hn1f","text":"Discard the flow through and collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m0io","text":"Place the spin column in a new 2 mL collection tube. Add 500 μL buffer AW2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14vit","text":"Centrifuge for 30 s. at 14,000 rpm (~20,000 x g). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s2mv","text":"Discard the flow through and collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gt13","text":"Transfer the spin column to a new 1.5 mL or 2 mL microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4o01j","text":"Elute the DNA by adding 200 μL buffer AE to the centre of the spin column membrane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be7ue","text":"Incubate for 1 min. at room temperature. This protocol is used to sample DNA from archived samples preserved in ethanol, without having to subsample or split the actual zooplankton biomass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eddak","text":"
Spatial coverage and environments of relevance
As part of the Hakai Institute Ocean Observing Program, biomolecular samples have been collected weekly, from 0 to near bottom (260 m), to genetically characterize plankton communities in the Northern Salish Sea since 2015, developing a climatology from which we can begin uncover the physical, chemical and biological drivers of community and functional change in the dynamic coastal waters of coastal British Columbia.
